description:
Imaginer is totally awesome. This app uses imaginative AI providers. It supports OpenAI but that requires a token while its default provider is "Stable Diffusion"(whatever that is). Anyway Stable Diffusion seems to be free, but if you try it a bit too much, like 7-9 times it will give you a message that you are rate limited. 

The app itself does not seem to collect any info about you since, after I moved to internet cafe, since they have another IP, I discovered in the other cafe that I was no longer limited...so its good the app does not spy on you and doesn't track you. It is licensed with GPLv3 or later which is good. It's FOSS.

If you want to use an imaginative AI that doesn't require a registration or a log in, this app is for you. I did not need to register in order to use it, I could use it right away after installing. If this is not the case for you, please provide your own review detailing your experience.

Thanks for your time!
There are a lot of issues. Wasted money generated images with OpenAI API that either doesn't display the image or doesn't save the image.
Would be nice to be able to only save one image at a time
Love it, Imaginer can generate everything. The app is beautiful
Installed and worked immediately. I really like how it saves the generated images automatically.
shows a white image with an error

Overall, this app shows promise as a desktop application. It's refreshing to have AI apps available on desktops, as they have mostly been dominant in the mobile space. However, there are areas where the app falls short and it is a waste of your money compared to some engines which are totally free and rendering by far better pictures.

One aspect that stood out was the quality of picture rendering, which unfortunately lags behind what I've experienced on platforms like Discord, browsers and on other apps. While the app's rendering is satisfactory, there are other AI engines available online that offer superior results for real-life picture rendering, and some even provide this service for free. Therefore, there is room for improvement in this aspect.

Despite the shortcomings, it's clear that the developers are on the right track. The app demonstrates potential and provides a glimpse into what could be achieved with further enhancements. I believe that with continued development and refinement, this app has the potential to become a competitive player in the field of AI picture rendering on desktops.

In conclusion, the AI picture rendering app shows promise as a desktop solution, but it currently falls short in terms of picture rendering quality compared to certain AI engines. It's commendable that efforts are being made to bring AI applications to desktop platforms, and I encourage the developers to keep refining and enhancing the app to reach its full potential.
summary: Desktop AI Picture Rendering App, but a waste of money

description: it kinda basic right now but still very good and had a big potential
Doesn't save. It was giving error when trying to save.

apparently reported 7 months ago.
image is saved however.
but; how saving image works unclear.

The program itself is flawless, but since the images you ask for to be 
created aren't locally generated this program can't be rated in how it generates anything,
since it doesn't.

Instead it uses various providers and the default provider is the open source
"Stable Diffusion" one. That being the default one is a good thing cause
it got 2 github repositories with at least one repo using the MIT license
which is an open source license. The other two licenses they also include in both
projects add some restrictions which make me not really know if its truly open source.

Anyway here's some stuff I tested with "Stable Diffusion"(again, the default provider they have):
a classic ship upgraded to a spaceship - yeah kinda, it was a good render
an extremely intelligent parrot - I guess...but I was expecting more
angry grandpa visiting the international space station - doesn't look too angry but we can see earth through a window
a parrot piloting a blimp - the parrot became the blimp
a parrot that looks dumb - it doesn't look neither smart nor dumb, its just a parrot.
a stupid looking whale - well, its not a whale inside the sea so...
chell and glados hug it out - decent render
complex personal computer sold to idiots - its just a pc
eiffel tower but it looks like a watermelon - no, it doesn't look like a watermelon, but its more red than before...
futuristic looking skateboard - not impressed
glados but full of honey - a bit impressed, but no she's not too full of honey
grandpa singing karaoke while floating in the air - maybe but he's absolutely singing though
guy at the gym looking like the hulk - he's not green but he got the brawn
mad labrat visiting the international space station - no sign of any rat in the render
thanos floored by an iguana - its just a guy with crocodile/iguana plushies
thanos getting punched by a parrot - no
the hulk but green, yellow and blue - super impressed! Very good!
summary: Default provider is open source "Stable Diffusion" default provider

description: Me gustaría que recordara la ubicación que selecciono para guardar las imágenes generadas

Está bien, aunque le falta bastante trabajo, ni siquiera pude guardar la imagen generada, para contrarestar eso tengo que decir que es super simple de usar aunque carece de parámetros extra y que no use Cpu o Gpu es un golazo. Por eso le doy un 4 pero recomiendo esperar un poco más.-
Requiere estar suscripto a un programa de IA externo. el propio está aun en desarrollo
Очень удобное приложение. Огромное спасибо разработчикам
Генерирует что-то рандомное, что не относится к описанию
